author: anneconnelly
title: Trust Graphic Novel & Motion Comic
description: Blockchain education isn't Africa-focused and often portrays Africans as the beneficiaries instead of the drivers of change.

assessments.note: Very impressive concept that focusses on cultural literacy...really enjoyed researching your proposal well done!
Education and motivation is important to drive growth of blockchain in Africa.

I think budget/outcome efficiency is not so effective. Also, creating just a "movie" is one thing, another is marketing and make people watch it. I watched the trailer, and I would not go to see such a movie. 

everyone has their own taste, for sure.
assessments.reply: We are catering the storytelling style of East Africa. Understandably, this will not necessarily be interesting to all the reviewers.

assessments.note: Motion comic on Cardano can improve the understanding of blockchain among children and can positively impact adoption. However, it is more of a propaganda value. It would be better if a problem of substance is solved to grow Africa in these initial days.
A high-quality motion comic & graphic-novel with a good story would surely teach and attract a lot of youth, especially from Africa, but definitely not limited to.

The images are well-crafted and the  snippet of the story is intriguing, but it does not seem to say how blockchain will be presented to the readers. It speaks about corruption in Africa, through current centralized power structures. And it implies decentralized power and financial structures will somehow counter this. But it does not say what the message will be—what will the youth be told in these media, about blockchain opportunities? It seems this might be remedied if the proposers worked with blockchain experts early on, in the development  of the script, rather than at the end of the production as in in their production schedule(?).
assessments.reply: Feedback is constructively worded, however, partially innacurate. One of the co-authors of the story is a blockchian expert and has been involved from the very start.

assessments.note: This proposal dialogues very well with the objectives of the challenge, as it aims to bring knowledge about cryptocurrencies and blockchain to young Africans, through art, the production of an illustrated story and also an audiovisual animation. In other words, it fits perfectly with what is proposed, and if the objectives of the campaign have been achieved (the authors aim to reach around 1 million Africans with the material), it will certainly be a great driver for the Catalyst community on the continent.
I do feel this sort of media, if distributed effectively, could have a considerable impact on blockchain knowledge and adoption in Africa.
The experience of proposers appears to match the stated aims well. The team have already produced quality material and the likelihood of successful implementation is high.

The proposer is faulty in blockchain and has authored books on bitcoin. The proposer has presented sufficient credentials to conclude that they have sufficient experience to successfully implement the proposal.
The trailer they have put up for the proposal is of genuine high-quality, proving the team's experience and capability in fulfilling the project.

The team is highly accomplished. Beautiful and well crafted images and animation. But the actual content for the story is somewhat vague, in terms of how is using the blockchain going to be presented. There are so many possibilities, that go beyond finance. If this will only address finance, then this should perhaps be stated explicitly. Otherwise it becomes more of a political statement about forms of government. Which is fine. But it is not about the educating people on the uses of blockchain.

he team that proposes to carry out the project is composed of an African artist and a Canadian blockchain specialist, that is, they are the basis of the project: the creative and the technical part. I believe that to boost success even more, it would be interesting to include someone with experience and manage the funding money, perhaps an administrator of similar projects, marketing people to publicize it and help to reach the goal… That is, to expand the team.

The teaser is compelling and apparently the project has received funding from other sources.  The team has connections to Africa and Blockchain. I think the real challenge here is distribution whether through Social Media or Television Networks. Being produced in Swahili as well as English should help in this respect. It would be good if they could show a stronger connection to media outlets in Africa.

Excellent information that conveys what this team is about and trying to achieve. Excellent links to working sites that provide examples of work in motion. Some query about budget breakdown although not sufficient to detract from overall proposal.

This proposal is feasible and if it reaches 1 million youths then could drive more Africans to engage with blockchain projects such as Cardano. If Cardano is funding this, will this just be a generic blockchain educational product, or will Cardano be featured in it?
maybe a number of watchers can be indicator, but if distributed worldwide, it would be not so precise, and I do not see a way /except writing down, that watching this movie brought me to cardano/.
assessments.reply: I don't understand the feedback this commenter is trying to convey

assessments.note: The success of the project is a subjective measure. Even outstanding audiovisual animated movies may not always produce the desired outcome. Therefore it won't be easy to measure the success of the project effectively.
After reading the proposal I see no questions unanswered and the fact that they have been able to source funding from other places too, is proof of their commitment and talent.

It seems there needs to be an outline provided on how the media will be used to educate on the use of blockchain. And that this may require interaction with blockchain experts and developers from Cardano. There is no doubt that they can produce a book and animation that has high production values and is well crafted. But it is unclear what the message will be about the uses of blockchain for the  youth in Africa. What possibilities will be presented? It is wonderful to mention that the youth are drivers not beneficiaries. So it seems if they are provided more insights into what the possibilities are with blockchain, specifically Cardano blockchain, it will only strengthen or arm the drivers, with insights for creativity and invention. Rather than entice them with wealth creation. This also occurred in the US in education, in the southern states. Where media education was interpreted by those who traditionally had no access financial opportunities. It ended up causing a non-productive and destructive outcome for the students.

A document was attached with a spreadsheet that details how the financing money would be used between the various stages of the project. In other words, there are no gaps in this regard. I just missed the establishment of a chronology of the practical steps, how would the process of creating this product be done? How many months would it take to make the drawings, to animate them, etc. It would be very beneficial to include a more chronological notion of everything, even to help the community to follow the progress of the process and provide feedback.

The 27K is for director and producer fees. The assumption is that the team has found funding for the preliminary aspects of the budget. This seems reasonable as long as that funding is real, because funding direction and production without a complete product ready to be directed and produced would potentially be a waste of funds.

solution: Trust is a transmedia project - both a graphic novel and motion comic - that teaches African teens and young adults about blockchain.
experience: The team is made up of Chief Nyamweya, a Kenyan artist, and Anne Connelly, a Canadian blockchain entrepreneur and educator.
